data.name: Energy Restore
rules: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put a Basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand. If you don't have that many basic Energy cards in your discard pile, put all of them into your hand.

data.name: Claw Fossil
rules: Play Claw Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play Claw Fossil counts as a Colorless Pokémon (as well as a Trainer card). Claw Fossil has no attacks of its own, can't retreat, and can't be affected by any Special Conditions. If Claw Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Claw Fossil from play.

abilities.name: Jagged Stone
abilities.text: If Claw Fossil is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Claw Fossil is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.name: Latios

attacks.name: Break Through
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: A highly intelligent Pokémon. By folding back its wings in flight, it can overtake jet planes.

data.name: Excadrill

attacks.name: Drill Run
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Straight Claw
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its heavy-looking iron body is actually thin and light, so it can fly at speeds over 180 mph.

data.name: TV Reporter
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

data.name: Focus Band
rules: Attach Focus Band to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.

If the Pokémon Focus Band is attached to would be Knocked Out by your opponent's attack, flip a coin. If heads, that Pokémon is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP become 10 instead. Then, discard Focus Band.

data.name: Double Colorless Energy
rules:
Provides ColorlessColorless energy.
Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.

rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, and if there are 66 or more damage counters on your Benched Pokémon, you may use this Ability. If you do, you win this game.

rules: Boost Energy can be attached only to an Evolved Pokémon. Discard Boost Energy at the end of the turn it was attached. Boost Energy provides ColorlessColorlessColorless Energy. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Blaine's Quiz #1
rules: Put a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card from your hand face down in front of you and tell your opponent its name. Your opponent guesses the length of that Pokémon. Flip the card over. data.name: Pokémon Contest Hall
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

Once during each player's turn, if that player's Bench isn't full, the player may flip a coin. If heads, that player searches his or her deck for a Basic Pokémon and puts it onto his or her Bench. If the player does, he or she may search his or her deck for a Pokémon Tool card and attach it to that Pokémon. If that player searched his or her deck, the player shuffles his or her deck afterward.

If the Pokémon that Holon Energy FF is attached to also has a basic Fighting Energy card attached to it, damage done by that Pokémon's attack isn't affected by Resistance. Ignore these effects if Holon Energy FF is attached to Pokémon-ex.

data.name: Deino

attacks.name: Deep Growl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Power Breath
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It tends to bit everything, and it is not a picky eater. Approaching it carelessly is dangerous.

data.name: Great Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Root Fossil
rules: Play Root Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Root Fossil counts as a Colorless Pokémon (as well as a Trainer card). Root Fossil has no attacks of its own, can't retreat, and can't be affected by any Special Conditions. If Root Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Root Fossil from play.

abilities.name: Spongy Stone
abilities.text: At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Root Fossil.

data.name: Sunyshore City Gym
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

Any damage done by attacks from Lightning Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) to the Defending Pokémon isn't affected by Resistance. Each Lightning Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) has no Weakness.

data.name: Silvally-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Gyro Unit
abilities.text: Your Basic Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Turbo Drive
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rebel-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lucario

abilities.name: Intuition
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Fast Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how others are feeling from over half a mile away.

data.name: Rainbow Energy
rules: Attach Rainbow Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Rainbow Energy provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.) When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. (While not in play, Rainbow Energy counts as Colorless Energy.)

data.name: Buizel
data.flavorText: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.

data.name: Hawlucha

abilities.name: Sudden Cyclone
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.

data.name: Holon Farmer
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Discard a card from your hand. If you can't discard a card from your hand, you can't play this card.
Search your discard pile for 3 basic Energy cards and any combination of 3 Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards, show them to your opponent, and put them on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: M Charizard-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crimson Dive
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Charity
rules: Attach Charity to your Active Pokémon. Unless that Pokémon gets Knocked Out, return Charity to your hand at the end of your turn. If that Pokémon attacks and does damage to the Defending Pokémon, you may reduce that damage by any amount (rounded to the nearest 10).

data.name: Lum Berry
rules: Attach Lum Berry to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.
At any time between turns, if the Pokémon this card is attached to is affected by any Special Conditions, remove all of them. Then discard Lum Berry.

data.name: Sylveon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Magical Ribbon
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Plea-GX
attacks.text: Put 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to them into your opponent's hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Ralts

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It uses the thorns on its head to sense human emotions. It is said to appear in front of cheerful people.

data.name: Venonat

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Venonat equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Venonat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

data.flavorText: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night.

data.name: Doublade

attacks.name: False Swipe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10.

data.flavorText: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.

data.name: Altaria Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Altaria-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Holon Energy GL
rules: Holon Energy GL provides Colorless Energy.

If the Pokémon that Holon Energy GL is attached to also has a basic Grass Energy card attached to it, that Pokémon can't be affected by any Special Conditions. If the Pokémon that Holon Energy GL is attached to also has a basic Lightning Energy card attached to it, damage done to that Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-ex is reduced by 10. Ignore these effects if Holon Energy GL is attached to Pokémon-ex.

data.name: Bulbasaur
data.flavorText: For some time after its birth, it grows by gaining nourishment from the seed on its back.

abilities.name: Catastrophe
abilities.text: As long as Gengar is your Active Pokémon, if any of your opponent's Pokémon would be Knocked Out, put that Pokémon in the Lost Zone instead of discarding. (Discard all cards attached to that Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hurl into Darkness
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand and choose a number of Pokémon you find there up to the number of Psychic Energy attached to Gengar. Put the Pokémon you chose in the Lost Zone.

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Zoroark

abilities.name: Stand In
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch this Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mind Jack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.

data.name: Terrakion

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Earthen Power
attacks.text: If you have a Stadium in play, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: It has phenomenal power. It will mercilessly crush anyone or anything that bullies small Pokémon.

data.name: Desert Ruins
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
At any time between turns, each player puts 1 damage counter on his or her Pokémon-ex with maximum HP of at least 100.

data.name: Slaking

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Knuckle Sandwich
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The world's laziest Pokémon. It moves to another spot when there's no food left within its reach.

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 1 or Stage 2 card that evolves from that Pokémon in your hand, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.)

data.name: Minccino

attacks.name: Tickle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Minccino greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails.

data.name: Staravia

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a Staravia cries noisily.

data.name: Dugtrio

attacks.name: Home Ground
attacks.text: If you have any Stadium card in play, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: While the three of them normally get along splendidly, on rare occasions a huge fight will break out over which head gets to eat first.

data.name: Muk ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Toxic Gas
abilities.text: As long as Muk ex is your Active Pokémon, ignore all Poké-Powers and Poké-Bodies other than Toxic Gas.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Slimy Water
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Colorless Energy in the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost).

data.name: Primal Kyogre-EX
rules: Primal Reversion rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes Primal Kyogre-EX, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

ancientTrait.name: θ Max
ancientTrait.text: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes this Pokémon, heal all damage from it.

attacks.name: Tidal Storm
attacks.text: Move 2 Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Incineroar-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Scar Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 3 damage counters on this Pokémon. If you do, search your deck for up to 3 Darkness Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Crushing Punch
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Darkest Tornado-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Super Energy Retrieval
rules: Trade 2 of the other cards in your hand for 4 basic Energy cards from your discard pile. If you have fewer than 4 basic Energy cards there, take all of them.

data.name: Venture Bomb
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, put 1 damage counter on 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Metal Energy
rules: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Dragalge

attacks.name: Severe Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck.

data.flavorText: Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where Dragalge live, never to return.

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Tapu Fini

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Shining Current
attacks.text: If any of your Water Pokémon was healed during this turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: The dense fog it creates brings the downfall and destruction of its confused enemies. Ocean currents are the source of its energy.

data.name: Rhyhorn
data.flavorText: It can remember only one thing at a time. Once it starts rushing, it forgets why it started.

data.name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Alph Lithograph
rules: Shuffle your deck!

data.name: Helix Fossil
rules: Play Helix Fossil as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Helix Fossil counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Helix Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Helix Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Helix Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Aqua Reaction
abilities.text: When you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Helix Fossil (excluding effects of attacks or Poké-Powers), search your deck for a card that evolves from Helix Fossil and put it onto Helix Fossil (this counts as evolving Helix Fossil). Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Haxorus

attacks.name: Stunning Uppercut
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.

data.name: Blaine
rules: During this turn, instead of attaching your free Energy card, you may instead attach 2 Fire Energy cards to 1 of your Pokémon with Blaine in its name. (Playing additional copies of this card this turn has no effect.)

data.name: Radio Tower
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Once during each player's turn (before attacking), that player may look at the top 2 cards of his or her deck and put them back in the same order.

data.name: Dedenne

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Electrichain
attacks.text: If you have any Lightning Pokémon on your Bench, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.

data.name: Flygon

abilities.name: Sand Slammer
abilities.text: At any time between turns, if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flying Beatdown
attacks.text: You may discard a Grass Energy and a Fighting Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Known as "The Desert Spirit" this Pokémon hides in the sandstorms it causes by beating its wings.

attacks.name: Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: M Swampert-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Strongarm Impact
attacks.text: You may do 30 more damage. If you do, discard the top 3 cards of each player's deck.

data.name: Slakoth

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Slakoth.

attacks.name: Slack Off
attacks.text: Remove all damage counters from Slakoth. Slakoth can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: It spends nearly all its time in a day sprawled out. Just seeing it makes one drowsy.

data.name: Ribombee

abilities.name: Curative Pollen
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.

data.name: Kirlia
data.flavorText: The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances when happy.

data.name: Furfrou

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.

data.name: Zweilous

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.

data.name: Deino

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.

data.name: Tapu Bulu-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Nature's Judgment
attacks.text: You may discard all Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Tapu Wilderness-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
